p: Due to the serious damage caused by fungal pathogens of agricultural interest, the possible future application of the essential oils as alternative antifungal agents was evaluated by [ 47]. In this study, T. mastichina essential oil showed either partial or complete antifungal activity against plant and mushroom pathogenic fungi ( Sclerotinia sclerotiorum, Fusarium oxysporum, Phytophthora parasitica, Alternaria brassicae, and Cladobotryum mycophilum) by the disk-diffusion assay; the inhibitory effect of essential oils was dose-dependent on the eight tested fungi enabling the determination of ED 50 values for most of them.
